alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 10:00AM CST until February 26 at 11:01AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee For the Tombigbee River...including Bigbee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying agricultural land is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 13.7 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 15.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage again early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
